cells.data:
0. Introduce yourself

My name is Zhengbin, I am grad student in santa clara university,my major is computer science and engineering.I will graduate in March this year.I just saw your posts in 1points3.com.

I’ve gained extensive experience in all aspects of software engineering, including java programming, web development, now I am focusing on the mean stack development. I am looking for a full-time software engineer position right now, if the internship position can accept grad student after graduate, it’s also ok for me. 

What’s more, one of my major strengths is that I work very hard and continually look for ways to provide the highest quality  to complete the work.  I am self-motivated and enjoy working in a team environment and also set up high goals and I've been told that I'm persistent. I’m looking for an opportunity to work for a growing company where I can contribute my hands-on experience and grow my career with the company. 

1. Why do you want this software engineer job?

  I’ve always been passionate about XXXXXXX, and I think you guys are doing great things, so I want to be a part of it

2. What are your biggest challenges as a front-end web developer?

    https://www.quora.com/What-are-your-biggest-challenges-as-a-front-end-web-developer
    1. Coding Javascript in a robust way. Backend software is evolved like PHP and Java ,they are relatively easy to create good, maintainable code there by using MVC and mature CMS's. With Javascript, I wouldn't say that it's as easy, You need to put more effort into making sure all Javascript is working in all browsers and that new code is written and placed in a maintainable way.
    2. Cross Browser Support. For ex.Chrome supports input type number ,while firefox has not yet implemented it.
     3. Layout Engine Softwares are different for different browsers. Ex.webkit(chrome),Gecko(firefox).
     4. Client Window sizes,your UI should be intact for all Screen Resolutions.
     5. Having to learn new and complex topics. Just recently, with the trend of Responsive Web Design, LESS & SASS CSS preprocessors and much more, it's become harder for the beginners to keep up.
